class_notes:
"Curatorial Practicum in Ancient Egyptian Art" will be taught in connection with the spring 2023 exhibition, "Life and the Afterlife: Ancient Egyptian Art from the Senusret Collection at the Michael C. Carlos Museum." Students will study objects from the Senusret Collection, which the Georges Ricard Foundation gifted to the MCCM in 2018. We will explore current debates in the field of museology in Egyptology. Using a selection of objects, individual student projects will incorporate all aspects of an exhibition, from object research, creating an object list and exhibition theme/subthemes to writing labels, panels, catalog descriptions, and producing social media content. Individual course assignments will be used to create a digital exhibition. Students will receive Shorthand and/or ArcGIS training as part of the course.
